DataElement.preferredName: Unrelated Allogenic Hematopoietic Cell Source Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the unrelated allogenic hematopoietic cell source.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Not connected or associated e.g. by kinship._Taken from different individuals of the same species.  Also called allogeneic._Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)_Where something is available or from where it originates.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Unrelated; not connected or associated e.g. by kinship.:Taken from different individuals of the same species.  Also called allogeneic.:Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)

Concepts.definition: Not connected or associated e.g. by kinship.
Taken from different individuals of the same species.

Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)
Where something is available or from where it originates.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Not connected or associated e.g. by kinship._Taken from different individuals of the same species.  Also called allogeneic._Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)_Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Fresh Tissue National Marrow Donor Program Tissue Donor Bone Marrow

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Fresh Tissue National Marrow Donor Program Tissue Donor Bone Marrow
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Tissue that is not frozen or embedded in preservatives: A non-profit organization based in Minneapolis, MN, that facilitates hematopoietic cell transplants for patients by connecting patients, doctors, donors and researchers to the resources they need.: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.: The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.

Concepts.definition: Tissue that is not frozen or embedded in preservatives

A non-profit organization based in Minneapolis, MN, that facilitates hematopoietic cell transplants and cellular therapies for patients by connecting patients, doctors, donors and researchers to the resources they need.
Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.
The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.

PermissibleValues.value: Fresh, NMDP donor mobilized peripheral blood stem cells
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Fresh Tissue National Marrow Donor Program Tissue Donor Mobilized Peripheral Blood Stem Cell

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Fresh Tissue National Marrow Donor Program Tissue Donor Mobilized Peripheral Blood Stem Cell
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Tissue that is not frozen or embedded in preservatives: A non-profit organization based in Minneapolis, MN, that facilitates hematopoietic cell transplants for patients by connecting patients, doctors, donors and researchers to the resources they need.: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.: Blood stem cells found in the circulation after being stimulated to leave the bone marrow, usually by treatment with a cytokine or other drug.

Concepts.definition: Tissue that is not frozen or embedded in preservatives

A non-profit organization based in Minneapolis, MN, that facilitates hematopoietic cell transplants and cellular therapies for patients by connecting patients, doctors, donors and researchers to the resources they need.
Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.
Blood stem cells found in the circulation after being stimulated to leave the bone marrow, usually by treatment with a cytokine or other drug.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Negation National Marrow Donor Program Umbilical Cord Blood

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Negation National Marrow Donor Program Umbilical Cord Blood
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: A non-profit organization based in Minneapolis, MN, that facilitates hematopoietic cell transplants for patients by connecting patients, doctors, donors and researchers to the resources they need.: Blood present in the umbilical vessels at the time of delivery. If cryopreserved at birth, cord blood can serve as a source of autologous lymphocytes for transplantation to a patient later diagnosed and treated for leukemia or lymphoma.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.

A non-profit organization based in Minneapolis, MN, that facilitates hematopoietic cell transplants and cellular therapies for patients by connecting patients, doctors, donors and researchers to the resources they need.

Blood present in the umbilical vessels at the time of delivery. If cryopreserved at birth, cord blood can serve as a source of hematopoietic progenitor cells for transplantation to a patient later diagnosed and treated for a hematopoietic disorder.

Blood present in the umbilical vessels at the time of delivery. If cryopreserved at birth, cord blood can serve as a source of hematopoietic progenitor cells for transplantation to a patient later diagnosed and treated for a hematopoietic disorder.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Artificial Neural Network Algorithm for BRIDG Mapping

ReferenceDocuments.name: Specify the source of the  un
ReferenceDocuments.description: Specify the source of the  unrelated allogenic hematopoietic cell:

ReferenceDocuments.name: BRIDG mapping path for CDE:2795099
ReferenceDocuments.description: "[CONCATINATION of {product condition} + {donor type} + {donor registry} + {product type}]  {product condition} is determined by:  PerformedSubstanceAdministration [current tranplant] > StudyAgent > Product > Subject > PerformedObservation > PerformedObservationResult.value WHERE PerformedSubstanceAdministration [current transplant] > DefinedSubstanceAdministration.nameCode = ""Administer Hematopoietic Stem Cell Product{Transplantation}"" AND PerformedObservation > DefinedObservation.nameCode = ""assess product condition""  {donor type} is determined by: [if {first donor} = {current donor} then ""original"" else ""new""]  {current donor} is determined by: PerformedSubstanceAdministration [current transplant] > SubstanceExtractionAdministrationRelationship > PerformedSubstanceExtraction > Subject WHERE PerformedSubstanceAdministration [current tranplant] > DefinedSubstanceAdministration.nameCode = ""Hematopoietic Stem Cell transplant""  {first donor} is determined by: PerformedSubstanceAdministration [current transplant] > Subject > PerformedSubstanceAdministration [first transplant] > SubstanceExtractionAdministrationRelationship > PerformedSubstanceExtraction > Subject  WHERE PerformedSubstanceAdministration [current transplant] > DefinedSubstanceAdministration.nameCode = ""Hematopoietic Stem Cell transplant"" AND PerformedSubstanceAdministration [first transplant] > DefinedSubstanceAdministration.nameCode = ""Hematopoietic Stem Cell transplant"" AND MINIMUM PerformedSubstanceAdministration.dateRange [first tranplant]  {donor registry} is determined by: PerformedSubstanceAdministration [current tranplant] > SubstanceExtractionAdministrationRelationship > PerformedSubstanceExtraction > Subject [donor] > SubjectIdentifier > DonorRegistry > Organization.name WHERE PerformedSubstanceAdministration [current tranplant] > DefinedSubstanceAdministration.nameCode = ""Hematopoietic Stem Cell transplant""  {product type} is determined by: PerformedSubstanceAdministration [current tranplant] > StudyAgent > Product > MaterialName.name WHERE PerformedSubstanceAdministration [current transplant] > DefinedSubstanceAdministration.nameCode = ""Hematopoietic Stem Cell transplant"""
